Welcome to RESTinPeace Api’s documentation!¶

RESTinPeace Api main¶

RESTinPeace Api repository Abstract¶

class src.repository.abstract.AbstractContactRepository¶

Bases: ABC

An abstract base class defining the interface for a contact repository.

Concrete implementations of this class must provide implementations for the abstract methods defined here.

abstract create_contact(new_contact: ContactIn, current_user: UserOut) → ContactOut¶

Create a new contact in the repository for the current user.

Parameters:

  • new_contact (ContactIn) – The ContactIn object representing the new contact to be created.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The user object representing the current user.

Returns:

A ContactOut object representing the created contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

abstract delete_contact(id: int, current_user: UserOut) → ContactOut¶

Delete a contact from the repository based on the provided ID and user.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The user object representing the current user.

Returns:

A ContactOut object representing the deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

abstract get_contact(id: int, current_user: UserOut) → ContactOut¶

Retrieve a contact from the repository based on the provided ID and user.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The user object representing the current user.

Returns:

A ContactOut object representing the retrieved contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

abstract get_contacts(current_user: UserOut) → list[ContactOut]¶

Retrieve contacts belonging to the current user from the repository.

Parameters:

current_user (UserOut) – The user object representing the current user.

Returns:

A list of ContactOut objects representing the retrieved contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactOut]

abstract update_contact(id: int, contact: ContactIn, current_user: UserOut) → ContactOut¶

Update an existing contact in the repository with new content provided.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactIn) – The ContactIn object representing the new content to update the contact with.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The user object representing the current user.

Returns:

A ContactOut object representing the updated contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

class src.repository.abstract.AbstractUserRepository¶

Bases: ABC

An abstract base class defining the interface for a user repository.

Concrete implementations of this class must provide implementations for the abstract methods defined here.

abstract confirm_email(email: str) → None¶

Confirm the email address of a user in the repository.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address to confirm.

Returns:

None

abstract create_user(new_user: UserIn) → UserOut¶

Create a new user in the repository.

Parameters:

new_user (UserIn) – The UserIn object representing the new user to be created.

Returns:

A UserOut object representing the created user.

Return type:

UserOut

abstract get_user_by_email(email: str) → UserOut¶

Retrieve a user from the repository based on the provided email.

Parameters:

email (str) – The email of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

A UserOut object representing the retrieved user.

Return type:

UserOut

abstract update_avatar(email, url: str) → UserOut¶

Update the avatar URL for a user in the repository.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to update.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL for the user.

Returns:

A UserOut object representing the updated user.

Return type:

UserOut

abstract update_token(user: UserOut, token: str | None) → None¶

Update the authentication token for a user in the repository.

Parameters:

  • user (UserOut) – The user object representing the user to update.

  • token – The new authentication token for the user. None if the token should be removed.

  • toke – str

Returns:

None

RESTinPeace Api repository Contacts¶

class src.repository.contacts.ContactRepository(db_session: Session)¶

Bases: AbstractContactRepository

async create_contact(new_contact: ContactIn, user: UserOut) → ContactOut¶

Create a new contact in the database for the given user.

Parameters:

  • new_contact (ContactIn) – The ContactIn object representing the new contact to be created.

  • user (UserOut) – The user object representing the owner of the contact.

Returns:

A ContactOut object representing the created contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

async delete_contact(id: int, user: UserOut) → ContactOut¶

Delete a contact from the database based on the provided ID and user.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user (UserOut) – The user object representing the owner of the contact.

Returns:

A ContactOut object representing the deleted contact, if found and deleted. None if no contact is found with the given ID and user.

Return type:

ContactOut or None

async get_contact(id: int, user: UserOut) → ContactOut¶

Retrieve a contact from the database based on the provided ID and user.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (UserOut) – The user object representing the owner of the contact.

Returns:

A ContactOut object representing the retrieved contact, if found. None if no contact is found with the given ID and user.

Return type:

ContactOut or None

async get_contacts(query, user: UserOut) → list[ContactIn]¶

Retrieve contacts from the database based on the provided query parameters and user.

Parameters:

  • query (dict) – A dictionary containing query parameters to filter contacts. Keys represent fields to filter on, and values represent desired values.

  • user (UserOut) – The user object representing the owner of the contacts.

Returns:

A list of ContactOut objects representing the retrieved contacts.

Return type:

list[ContactOut]

async get_upcoming_birthdays(user: UserOut) → list[ContactIn]¶

Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays for the given user within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

user (UserOut) – The user object representing the owner of the contacts.

Returns:

A list of ContactOut objects representing the contacts with upcoming birthdays. None if no contacts have upcoming birthdays within the next 7 days.

Return type:

list[ContactOut] or None

async update_contact(id: int, new_content: ContactIn, user: UserOut) → ContactOut¶

Update an existing contact in the database with new content provided.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • new_content (ContactIn) – The ContactIn object representing the new content to update the contact with.

  • user (UserOut) – The user object representing the owner of the contact.

Returns:

A ContactOut object representing the updated contact. None if no contact is found with the given ID and user.

Return type:

ContactOut or None

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The new authentication token for the user. None if the token should be removed.

Returns:

RESTinPeace Api routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirm_email(token: str, users_repository: AbstractUserRepository = Depends(get_users_repository))¶

Endpoint to confirm the email address using the verification token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The verification token.

  • users_repository (AbstractUserRepository) – The repository for user data.

  • auth_service (HandleJWT) – The JWT handling service.

Returns:

A message indicating the confirmation status.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException 400 – If there is a verification error.

async src.routes.auth.login(login_form: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), users_repository: AbstractUserRepository = Depends(get_users_repository), pwd_handler: AbstractPasswordHashHandler = Depends(get_password_handler)) → Token¶

Endpoint for user login.

Parameters:

  • login_form (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The login form containing username (email) and password.

  • users_repository (AbstractUserRepository) – The repository for user data.

  • pwd_handler (AbstractPasswordHashHandler) – The password hashing handler.

  • auth_service (HandleJWT) – The JWT handling service.

Returns:

The generated access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

Token

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the email, password, or email verification is invalid.

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), users_repository: AbstractUserRepository = Depends(get_users_repository)) → Token¶

Endpoint to refresh the access token using the refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTP Authorization Credentials containing the refresh token.

  • users_repository (AbstractUserRepository) – The repository for user data.

  • auth_service (HandleJWT) – The JWT handling service.

Returns:

The generated access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

Token

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the refresh token is invalid.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, users_repository: AbstractUserRepository = Depends(get_users_repository))¶

Endpoint to request sending an amail address verifacion email.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request body containing the email address to be confirmed.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks to be executed.

  • request (Request) – The incoming request.

  • users_repository (AbstractUserRepository) – The repository for user data.

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the request.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(new_user: UserIn, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, users_repository: AbstractUserRepository = Depends(get_users_repository), pwd_handler: AbstractPasswordHashHandler = Depends(get_password_handler)) → UserOut¶

Endpoint to register a new user.

Parameters:

  • new_user (UserIn) – The user details to be registered.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks to be executed.

  • request (Request) – The incoming request.

  • users_repository (AbstractUserRepository) – The repository for user data.

  • pwd_handler (AbstractPasswordHashHandler) – The password hashing handler.

Returns:

The registered user details.

Return type:

UserOut

Raises:

HTTPException 409 – If the account already exists.

RESTinPeace Api routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactIn, contacts_repository: AbstractContactRepository = Depends(get_contacts_repository), current_user: UserOut = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactOut¶

Create a new contact for an authorized user

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactIn) – The contact data to create.

  • contacts_repository (AbstractContactRepository) – The repository for contact data.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

async src.routes.contacts.get_current_user(token: OAuth2PasswordBearer = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), users_repository: AbstractUserRepository = Depends(get_users_repository), redis: Redis = Depends(get_redis_client)) → UserOut¶

Get the current authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The OAuth2 token.

  • users_repository (AbstractUserRepository) – The repository for user data.

  • redis (Redis) – The Redis client.

  • auth_service (HandleJWT) – The JWT handling service.

Returns:

The current authenticated user.

Return type:

UserOut

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the credentials are invalid.

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), contacts_repository: AbstractContactRepository = Depends(get_contacts_repository), current_user: UserOut = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactOut¶

Get a contact by ID for authorized user

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact.

  • contacts_repository (AbstractContactRepository) – The repository for contact data.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The current authenticated user .

Returns:

The contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If the contact is not found.

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(first_name: str | None = Query(None), last_name: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), contacts_repository: AbstractContactRepository = Depends(get_contacts_repository), current_user: UserOut = Depends(get_current_user)) → list[ContactOut]¶

Get contacts based on query parameters for authorized user

Parameters:

  • first_name (str, optional) – The first name of the contact (optional).

  • last_name (str, optional) – The last name of the contact (optional).

  • email (str, optional) – The email address of the contact (optional).

  • contacts_repository (AbstractContactRepository) – The repository for contact data.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactOut]

async src.routes.contacts.read_upcoming_birthdays(contacts_repository: AbstractContactRepository = Depends(get_contacts_repository), current_user: UserOut = Depends(get_current_user)) → list[ContactOut]¶

Get a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays (7 days) for authorized user.

Parameters:

  • contacts_repository (AbstractContactRepository) – The repository for contact data.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactOut]

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If no upcoming birthdays are found.

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), contacts_repository: AbstractContactRepository = Depends(get_contacts_repository), current_user: UserOut = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactOut¶

Remove a contact from database by ID for authorized user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to be removed.

  • contacts_repository (AbstractContactRepository) – The repository for contact data.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The removed contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If the contact with the specified ID is not found.

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact: ContactIn, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), contacts_repository: AbstractContactRepository = Depends(get_contacts_repository), current_user: UserOut = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactOut¶

Update a contact by ID for authorized user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactIn) – The updated contact data.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to be updated.

  • contacts_repository (AbstractContactRepository) – The repository for contact data.

  • current_user (UserOut) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

Raises:

HTTPException 404 – If the contact with the specified ID is not found.

RESTinPeace Api routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(token: OAuth2PasswordBearer = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), users_repository: AbstractUserRepository = Depends(get_users_repository), redis: Redis = Depends(get_redis_client)) → UserOut¶

  • token (str) – The OAuth2 token.

  • users_repository (AbstractUserRepository) – The repository for user data.

  • redis (Redis) – The Redis client.

  • auth_service (HandleJWT) – The JWT handling service.

Returns:

The current authenticated user.

Return type:

UserOut

Raises:

HTTPException 401 – If the credentials are invalid.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The details of the current authenticated user.

Return type:

UserOut

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), users_repository: AbstractUserRepository = Depends(get_users_repository), redis: Redis = Depends(get_redis_client))¶

Update the avatar of the current authenticated user via cloudinary upload service

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The image file to upload as the new avatar.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • users_repository (AbstractUserRepository) – The repository for user data.

  • redis (Redis) – The Redis client.

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar.

Return type:

UserOut

RESTinPeace API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.HandleJWT(secret_key: str, algorithm: str)¶

Bases: object

Class to handle JSON Web Tokens (JWT).

Parameters:

  • secret_key (str) – The secret key used to sign the tokens.

  • algorithm (str) – The algorithm used for token signing.

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generate a new access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The payload data to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Optional. The expiration time delta in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Generate a new token for email verification.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The payload data to include in the token.

Returns:

The encoded email verification token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generate a new refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The payload data to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – Optional. The expiration time delta in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode and verify a refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email address extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or has an invalid scope.

async get_email_from_access_token(token: str)¶
async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Parameters:

token (str) – The email verification token.

Returns:

The email address extracted from the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid.

Sends an email to the specified recipient for email confirmation.

  • username (str) – The username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – The host URL for the application.

RESTinPeace API service Password Handler¶

class src.services.pwd_handler.AbstractPasswordHashHandler¶

Bases: ABC

An abstract base class defining the interface for a password hashing handler.

Concrete implementations of this class must provide implementations for the abstract methods defined here.

abstract get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Generate a hashed password from the provided plain password.

Parameters:

password – The plain password to be hashed.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

abstract verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Verify if the provided plain password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain password to be verified.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to be compared against.

Returns:

True if the plain password matches the hashed password, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class src.services.pwd_handler.BcryptPasswordHandler(rounds: int = 12)¶

Bases: AbstractPasswordHashHandler

A concrete implementation of the AbstractPasswordHashHandler interface that uses the bcrypt hashing algorithm.

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Generate a hashed password from the provided plain password.

Parameters:

password – The plain password to be hashed.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Verify if the provided plain password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain password to be verified.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to be compared against.

Returns:

True if the plain password matches the hashed password, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
